result.execSummary:
The defendant RICKY R VAN SCHYNDEL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. RICKY R VAN SCHYNDEL is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • RICKY R VAN SCHYNDEL was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
consecutive
08-26-22:  AMENDED CREDIT FROM 122 DAYS TO 121 DAYS PURSUANT TO LETTER FROM DEPT. OF CORRECTIONS FILED ON 08-24-22

superMiscConds.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.   Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.

Undertake AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Pay supervisory fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Immediately following court, contact Court Security at 920-236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  The appointment location is:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

supervisions.notes: IID requirement applies to all vehicles which are registered in your name and any vehicles you operate.  During your IID requirement period, you may not operate any motor vehicle without an IID installed.

No alcohol consumption or possession.  Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.
